abstract: Prosecutor in murder case of Etan Patz delivers four-and-half-hour summation, stressing that many confessions by suspect Pedro Hernandez are credible and have never been retracted; defense argues that confessions are unreliable based on Hernandez's low IQ and personality disorder and presents evidence pointing to possible other suspect Jose A Ramos; jury is set to begin deliberations.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor, Joan Illuzzi-Orbon, told a jury that the defendant, Pedro Hernandez, had never retracted any of his confessions about killing a boy.

headline.main: In Closing, Prosecutor in Etan Patz Case Says Suspect’s Many Confessions Ring True
headline.print_headline: In Summation, Prosecutor in Patz Case Says Suspect’s Many Confessions Ring True

snippet: The prosecutor, Joan Illuzzi-Orbon, told a jury that the defendant, Pedro Hernandez, had never retracted any of his confessions about killing a boy.
